channel.title: Creatures üëπüõ¥
channel.description: A blog about the open source business project - Creatures

item.title: Idea / Project Goals
item.description: Bird, Limes, bah! How hard can it be to create a scooter share? üòÅ Walking to work I see plenty of electric scooters on the side walk, and I‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Bird, Limes, bah! How hard can it be to create a scooter share? üòÅ

Walking to work I see plenty of electric scooters on the side walk, and I figure I could make something like that. So here it goes, let‚Äôs see what it takes to replicate a service similar to what existing scooter shares offer. Now obviously, being just one person I cannot actually compete with a startup like, Bird nor do I intend to make a product that has the same level of polish and features as theirs. I am shooting for a service that is a rough approximation at a way smaller scale.

The basic idea behind Creatures is to see what it takes to start up a company, document the process, and open source as much as possible; in effect create a business model as an open source project.

My intention is not to necessarily start up a successful company, rather it is to experiment, learn a lot, and maybe have a bit fun.

Goals

  • Learn

    • Starting a Business / LLC
    • AWS - Amazon Web Services
    • IOT - Internet of Things
    • Serverless
    • Gatsby
    • Supporting Charity

  • Automate

    • Bulk of project automated - infrastructure as code

  • Document & Share

    • Project Blog
    • Create How to Guide, with corresponding git repo

  • Low Cost

    • Focus on a minimal viable product and a low barrier to entry.
    • Raise money for charity - match at least the project cost

Easy peasy‚Ä¶

item.title: Rolling Project Log
item.description: A sequential log of project steps I will update this as the project progresses Write down ideas for app Start researching creating an‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
A sequential log of project steps

I will update this as the project progresses

  1. Write down ideas for app
  2. Start researching creating an android app and options for embedded device
  3. Research scooter options
  4. Decide to re-purpose phone for on-board scooter device
  5. Discover automate app for android
  6. Test out automate app
  7. Order scooter
  8. Start testing out using AWS for hosting
  9. Move personal site to AWS
  10. Complete AWS server less tutorial
  11. Start creating Cloud formation templates for AWS structure of app
  12. Further brainstorming and testing of AWS
  13. Start on website front end using react-create-app
  14. Decide on using bootstrap for framework
  15. Remove stickers and residue from scooter
  16. Paint grip tape
  17. Create rough mockup of site
  18. Upload site S3
  19. Discover AWS Amplify
  20. Use Amplify to re-upload site and connect with a Coginto user pool
  21. Added FAQ
  22. Added start ride page ‚Äî imported stopwatch, QR Reader projects
  23. Learned about React router useful guide
  24. Discover Serverless Framework and compared with Terraform
  25. Serverless boilerplate
  26. Created test backend api with Serverless - following this guide
  27. Fixed application flows

  28. Create ride timer element:

    • https://wsvincent.com/react-stopwatch/
    • https://blog.predovan.com/2017/02/25/How-to-create-a-simple-React-Stopwatch-app/
  29. Updated API so that scooters can request self check status
  30. Ordered Project Box
  31. Attached Project Box to scooter
  32. Designed Logo
  33. Added Handle bar Bracket
  34. Designed First Creature - Zi
  35. Finished Splash Screen Illustration
  36. Finished creature sketches
  37. Finished draft of frontend
  38. Research starting a LLC
  39. Start Gatsby Project Blog ‚Äî using starter blog

Costs so far

I will update this as the project progresses

Kick Scooter $76
Plastic Project Box $11
